P.Span: The Store Banner Dashboard compares the performance of three different store banners: FAST, GRAND and MODA. Each banner represents a different type of store.

Use the key value metrics along the top to quickly compare banners. Notice that MODA has a much higher marketing budget as a percent of its total sales, but the bar/line chart belowshows that this is not translating to higher sales. This could be due to the merchandise categories of Health and Grocery.

The charts on the bottom showhow sales and marketing budgets relate by store banner. Again, you can see that the MODA banner is lagging in sales performance in relation to its budget. Double-click on any bar to drill to the top five classifications within the category. Double-click on health under GRAND to see that "face" sales are less than a tenth of the marketing budget. Perhaps that marketing effort needs to be re-worked.

Graph.name: ve371
Graph.label: ROI Region Map
Graph.description: This Geo Map shows the adjusted ROI by state.

VisualElements.Graph:
bi7954
Map of Adjust ROI by State (darker color means higher ROI) <StatGraph attrPriority="color" includeMissingDiscrete="true" missingValueDisplay="autolabel" opaque="false"> <PadAttrs bottom="0px" left="0px" right="0px" top="0px"/> <Meta> <DataNameMap> <Entry data="dd374" model="LayoutOverlayMap"/> </DataNameMap> </Meta> <LayoutOverlayMap cycleAttrs="true" cycleColorResponses="true" name="LayoutOverlayMap"> <MapLayer dataTransparency="0" name="MapLayer"/> <MapRegionLayer auxiliary="Role1 Role1" colorResponse="dd374#bi7532" dataSetName="dd374#bi6696" dataTransparency="0.125" identification="dd374#bi6695" name="MapRegionLayer" tip="Role2 Role3 Role4 Role5 Role1 colorResponse"> <SASRegionMapProvider/> <Roles> <Role name="Role1" type="variable">dd374#bi6697</Role> <Role name="Role2" type="variable">dd374#bi7975</Role> <Role name="Role3" type="variable">dd374#bi7976</Role> <Role name="Role4" type="variable">dd374#bi7977</Role> <Role name="Role5" type="variable">dd374#bi7978</Role> </Roles> </MapRegionLayer> </LayoutOverlayMap> <LayoutGlobalLegend allowCollapsed="false" border="false" legendTitlePosition="top" visible="off"> <ContinuousLegend border="false" displayMissing="automatic" extractScale="true" opaque="false" title="AUTO" title_type="KEYWORD" type="fillcolor" vAlign="bottom" valueStyle="inflections"> <PadAttrs bottom="2px" left="2px" right="2px" top="2px"/> <GraphNames> <Value>MapRegionLayer</Value> </GraphNames> </ContinuousLegend> </LayoutGlobalLegend> <Animation keyframesPerSecond="1" playDirectionForward="true" repeatEnabled="false"/>
</StatGraph>

Span.Span: Identify the performance of various regions and states. Use this analysis to make decisions on new store locations and store modifications and/or improvements using current and forecasted sales.

P.Span: The section helps you identify the performance of various regions and states.
The bar chart shows both regular and adjusted sales. Click the US Midwest bar to filter the map.

You can adjust sales by dragging the slider to the right or left to see the increase or decrease. Adjust the salesto a 20% decrease. You can see the difference in the region bar chart and the Geo Map.
The Geo Map shows the Adjusted ROI by state. If you hover over a state you will see important metricsabout that state.
This type of analysis is useful for making decisions about new store locations, store modifications, and/or store improvements using current or forecasted sales.

Span.Span: Assess the success of promotions by comparing actual revenue to forecast and baseline revenue. Select individual productsto further refine results.

P.Span: The Promotion Effectiveness report helps marketers know how promotions are performing compared with forecast and baseline. If a promotion performs well against a baseline, that shows effective targeting and offer management. Showing the forecast also helps the department understand how close to projections it is. Being far off of forecasts can lead to marketing budget mismanagement.

The top right of the report shows the overall metric onhow a promotion performed. The results are compared with the baseline (the incremental impact) and the forecast (compared with the target), and the forecast is compared with the baseline (initial projected incremental impact). In this case, even though the promotion had an incremental impact, the forecast was too high. This could lead to revenue projections that are unattainable.
Select Iamz Puppy Large Breed from the left tile chart to highlight the corresponding Size, Age and Health tableon the right. The Promotional Sales Lift also adjusts to the selected product.
If you select a value on the Small product line in thetable, the four products associated will be highlighted.
